reviews.text: Empanada Mama LES is a fantastic spot that brings bold, authentic Latin flavors to every bite. The empanadas are perfectly crispy on the outside and filled with delicious, freshly made ingredients inside. The staff is friendly, efficient, and always makes you feel welcome. It‚Äôs a lively, cozy place perfect for late-night bites or casual dining.
Open 24/7 Excellent food
FAVORITE late night spot, we try to go here anytime we‚Äôre in the area!! The sauces are the best so don‚Äôt skip out on adding them as sides
Tr√®s bien
Soooo good!
Camilo is the man.  Got a large order for 80 people prepared for me seamlessly in 90 minutes.
Happened to walk by and see Empanada Mama so we decided to stop. It did not disappoint!! Service was amazing and food was even better. They were so friendly

The chef in lower east side location on 10/23 night shift was cooking and touching everything BAREHANDED!

The owner should watch the cameras more often, very surprised this is allowed in such a busy area.
I‚Äôm absolutely disgusted! Management didn‚Äôt  notice either!

Boycott this location and go to better restaurants who actually care about food safety.
Great service every time I come here to eat. The server Beyonce always goes above and beyond to make sure im attended to

I had an Arepa cheesesteak from here and woke up with food poisoning. Vomitting and diarrhea. Missed work.

I‚Äôve ate here before plenty of times, no issues so I don‚Äôt know what happened.
Excelente servicio y calidad
As always, Empanada Mama is a city favorite! I love their Plantain chips and guac! The best around.
Always fresh and delicious! I make it a point to come get empanadas every time I'm in the city. Staff is so friendly. Thank you!
Las mejores empanadas, diferentes, buen sabor, frescas.. Su atenci√≥n y orden es muy bueno. Super recomendado
Not bad for a late night snack!
Very tasty empanadas, the corn beef and seafood were excellent. The sweet fried plantains similarly so.
I paid $30 for this on seamless and it looks like a lunch special . The steak was rushed . I will not be ordering from here again. So disappointed !
A classic love all their choices of empanadas
Love the empanadas and went to for happy hour.  Go check ot out.
This place is soooooo good so many options and the oxtail one is the best! Very affordable and I love that they have dine in seating. They get very crowded so keep that in mind.
Delish! Food and drinks were awesome.
Wow! Delicious and great prices! Empanadas are super good! We did not like the drink but food 100% good!
The empanadas are good
The food was good, hot and served quickly! Great for a late night eats
Cierra. Temprano y el se√±or q atiende es muy grosero de verdad cero empat√≠a

I got the cubana Arepa and the flavor on it was incredible. That pork was so tender and delicious, it made it a great experience. I did have to pull off half of the cheese on it bc it was way too much, but that‚Äôs just personal preference. Our server was very kind and informative when it came to ordering.

I have celiac so I asked if the wheat and corn empanadas shared a fryer and sadly they do, so no empanada for me.

I noticed after the fact that the arepa was also fried, so I‚Äôm not sure if those share a fryer as well. I took gluten-ease and an allergy pill preemptively, so I‚Äôll update if there‚Äôs any noticeable adverse effects for my fellow celiacs.

They have plenty of non-fried options too just fyi!

Edit: I did feel a little weird after the arepa, so best to just avoid the dried food if you have a strong sensitivity/cealiac.
They do not split checks please change that
Front desk gets overwhelmed by drunk customers espceially on the weekends

If I can give this spot 0 stars I would. I waited 35 minutes for 4 empanadas. After getting it they were missing my drink and told me they were making it and the decided to make it 15 minutes after that. If you gonna get something here you are better off uber eats it. All the people in there have the nastiest attitude. Like I didn‚Äôt ask to work there‚Ä¶. Yall did!!!!üíØü§ûüèº

Great 24/7 spot, open late, always good food for a good price. The only place open late in the area that is decent, cheap and good for groups small and large. We got El Toro, Bourbon, Portabello and Rice and Beans. The green sauce is always a house favorite, red less so. We ordered around 50 empanadas for our group and they were a hit. Their service is also fast and easy.

Visiting the city, my son was craving empanadas and this is his favorite place. I could only eat one of the empanadas (shredded chicken) but it was a FLAVOR-BOMB!! The pastry was so incredibly flaky and perfectly cooked!! So freaking delicious!!! Post-script: you MUST have the green sauce...(swoon...)!
Delicious food Colombian style !!!
This is an institution and should be visited by all. Been coming here for over 10 years. I stand on it.

Realmente la comida me desilusion√≥, soy colombiana y no sab√≠a nada a comida colombiana, el sancoch√≥ de cola estaba tan salado que nos toc√≥ rendirlo con agua para poder darle a nuestro beb√© y el arroz con pollo poquito para los precios tan altos quedamos con hambre pero bueno la atenci√≥n del mesero fue buena, l√°stima los precios tan altos por porciones tan peque√±as, no volver√≠a ni lo recomiendo.
These guys are the absolute best

I had the worst experience at this location the general manager Evan was yelling and screaming at his employees in front of all the customers. He even made one of his employees cry in front of me.  I have visited this location twice and I've witnessed this same behavior with this general manager both times. This is a very toxic environment to dine in because of this man's poor ignorance and bad behavior towards his employees. Something needs to be done about that man or this establishment will continue to lose business!
Gas

What a disappointment. I was visiting New York and heard great things about "Empanadas Mam√°s," so I decided to check it out. But the experience was nothing like I expected. I arrived at their 14th St and 1st Ave location around 9:45 PM, and‚Ä¶

Still Love Empanada Mama, But‚Ä¶

I absolutely love Empanada Mama‚Äîespecially for their gluten-free empanadas (huge win!) and perfectly cooked maduros. As always, everything was hot, fresh, and delicious. The staff member who brought out our food was so kind and pleasant‚Äîit made the experience even better.

The only downside this time was the maduros portion. The container wasn‚Äôt as full as usual, which was a bit disappointing, especially considering the price and how much I love them. Still, I‚Äôll definitely be back‚Äîjust hoping for a fuller serving next time
La comida fue lo mejor de este lugar , tiene buena textura, muy crujiente y saber genial üòÅ
Not at the place, but the order was small portion, and tasteless, the rice and beans so bland, the over priced flan, no bueno.
This place is open 24/7, the food is amazing, the service is great and very attentive by everyone.

So when LoKeyStudios and myself find ourselves on the LES of NYC we have to make a stop at Empanada Mama's it has become a ritual for us. Coming from central NY where we lack Empanada mama's its a wonderful city treat my go to is the Viagra which is a seafood filled Empanada, the reggaeton Empanada always hits as well as the El Toro, I won't lie I don't think you can pick a wrong one but dont forgotto add the green sauce it will change your life. Don't forget to grab the mango juice to pair with it and you will be thanking us later.
"They have very poor service.

Love this spot, some of my favorites are the Bandeja Paisa, sancocho de cola, Sangria

El sancocho de hoy took me back to when la cocinera Mia Yoba me hacia to lo remedio del mundo pa curarme el jumo.! ‚ù§Ô∏èüôèüèΩ ty ‚úåÔ∏è
Back to buisness a usual!

Last night was my first time at Empanada mam√°!!! ü•≥ i arrived with a group of friends and absolutely. ¬°¬° LOVED THE WARM WELCOME!! ü§© you can truly feel the latin Flavor ü•óüëå Throughout the establishment.

We spent several enjoyable hours there!! And i‚Äôm specially grateful to JuanDa!! Who greeted us with incredible charisma!!üòé He stepped out from behind the register and quickly found us a table, even Taking the time to clean it thoroughly for all of us.‚ú®‚ú®

We‚Äôre looking forward to comino back to EMPANADA MAMA SOON!!! ‚ú®‚ú®üëå
Love the empanadas , slightly over priced for Colombian empanadas, but they taste good
Great food üòã
Delicioso!
Í∞ÄÍ≤©ÎåÄÎπÑ Í∑∏Îã•...ÎßéÏù¥ Î®πÍ∏∞ÏóêÎäî Ï¢Ä ÎäêÎÅºÌñàÏùå

Empanada Mama is great every time and open 24 hours a day. It‚Äôs easy to order ahead online, use the kiosks in-store, the take-out counter, or have a seat for table service, including a bar. I‚Äôve never had a bad experience, at any location, since I started going regularly over 5 years ago. Everything is full-flavor from food to sauces.

The Buffalo Chicken Empanada is the best way to eat buffalo chicken. It is one of their fried wheat varieties. The outside is crispy, thin and light and the inside is packed, as full as possible, with shredded buffalo chicken. The empanada breading gives way to a pleasing crunch. The chicken is soft with a sweet, savory, and spicy flavor. It is already so delicious that you don‚Äôt need a sauce, but it comes with one that balances everything with a creamy tanginess that ups the flavor.

The Banana Nutella Empanada is one of my favorites - one of their baked wheat varieties. It is topped with cinnamon and sugar that gives a caramelized and crispy outside. The center is filled with warm Nutella and a banana. It‚Äôs very fun to eat.

They have over 40 varieties of empanadas. They serve baked wheat and fried wheat and corn empanadas. They are a first-floor, store-front with no stairs to enter or dine. The decor and atmosphere are bright and exciting. It can get loud during busy hours.
Amazing empanadas great beers and juice selection, all the waitstaff was amazing

My service at this place was pleasant. My low rating has to do with the food quality. I‚Äôm disappointed with the quality and taste of the food at Empanada Mama.

I ordered two empanadas as you can see in the images: Beef Empanada made with corn flour and Cheese empanada made with white flour.

The wait time for the empanadas was longer than anticipated. Personally I‚Äôd like to think the wait time was longer because of the quality so I could live with up to 10 minutes of waiting :).

However, I unfortunately did not enjoy my empanadas as I‚Äôd hoped. Firstly, my cheese empanada was like any cheese ‚Äúpastelito‚Äù since (as seen in pictures) this was really mostly air than empanada. Secondly, my cheese was marked with some kind of ink. (Seen in pic). I would appreciate it if were informed of what this is?

My beef empanada made with corn flour was unfortunately not much better. I did not enjoy the taste of the beef and the mixture of tomato sauce or seasoning it had. The corn flour base was interesting and personally new for me, but it was honestly not an empanada I enjoyed eating.

I do appreciate the man who took my order. He answered my questions and gave me recommendations.

It is unfortunate but I do not see myself ordering from any Empanda Mama moving forward. It wasn‚Äôt a pleasant experience.

Stopped in here walking around Sunday. I ordered the pulled pork and also the ham and cheese empanadas. They both were very good and the portions were great. I used tablets on the wall to order but it was annoying it took 6 tries but it finally took my card. I would definitely recommend you visit if in the area
Omg this place is awesome! The food is worth waiting for. Open late. Cross section of cultures and fashion show too! Can't recommend enough.

We came to Empanada Mama to celebrate my graduation, and Felipe made our experience absolutely unforgettable! From the moment we were seated, he was warm, attentive, and incredibly kind. He made us feel so special and celebrated, going above and beyond to ensure everything was perfect. His energy was uplifting, and his service was flawless. Felipe truly made the night one to remember  thank you for being a part of such a meaningful milestone! üéìüíõ

Highly recommend asking for Felipe when you visit he‚Äôs the best!

I moved away from New York for just over two years. I returned only a few weeks ago and made the train trip from Brooklyn to the LES just to get my beautiful empanadas from Empanada Mama. Even years later, this place is still absolutely amazing! One of their new employees who tends the bar, Daniel, was an absolute angel. Because of him, I wound up getting one of their Nutcracker frozen drinks‚Ä¶ By the way, they are AMAZING! If he didn‚Äôt upsell me like you should do in a business, I would‚Äôve left there with only what I had ordered in the beginning. Thank you Daniel for making my experience so nice! And Evan, you are the absolute man! Best manager of a restaurant I‚Äôve ever met, and I worked in food service for many years. I hope to see both of you again my next visit. I will be visiting very soon. Thanks to you :)

Empanadas tr√®s bons et copieux par contre c'est tr√®s tr√®s gras, ils sont frits dans l'huile, j'ai l'habitude de manger des empanadas dans d'autres endroits mais ils sont cuits au four. Le service √©tait sympa et rapide.

To start, this place surprised me very much. I was a little ehhhd by the price tag of a $4.80 empanada especially because I‚Äôve been to Colombia where you get empanadas for $1 or less. BUT, this was actually magnificent. The flavor was wow, it was fresh, crispy, not dry on the inside & full of flavor. I got the beef & the viagra (shrimp) idk why they call the damn thing viagra üòÇ but definitely worth a try, was great !!!

DO NOT BUY FOOD FROM THIS PLACE !! I placed an order through DoorDash and my food came greasy and seeping through the bag. With a dead fly on the bag. I called the store to speak to someone about this issue they put me on hold and Juan picked up the phone. I addressed my issue being that I always buy food from this place.  I was expecting to be treated way better than I was. Juan asked me to send a picture of the fly on the bag. As if that was all he was concerned about. I sent him a picture of the food and he said to me ‚Äúis this a joke‚Äù he immediately got defensive and blamed how the food came on the dasher that it was his fault & how he can‚Äôt reimburse me I have to call DoorDash and hung up very rude and unprofessional.

The place location is not the best. The food in not healthy but the opposite. Old oil and cheap products. The service is good if you leave tips but if you don't, they become grumpy. Too expensive for what it is. For a few more dollars you can eat better places better and healthier food. This is poison. Ask your hemorrhoids and heartburn next time you eat here.

Came here after hearing it being recommended by Monet X Change on her podcast. Was not disappointed at all. Everything was really good, each empanada stuffed full of filling, and everything was fresh. Place was cute and service fast.

my boyfriend and i have been trying chicharron from many places before but this is by far not the best. We were in the area and wanted to try this places chicharron, as expected the reviews are amazing the places looks vibrant but the food not so much. Now of course i‚Äôm not saying all the food here was bad as we only got the chicharron and guacamole but the pork was mostly just fat and it was disgusting, we ate the two that had the most meat on it but the fat was too much my boyfriend almost threw up. The guac on the other hand was amazing.
This place is amazing!!!  I had the corn flour empanadas (BBQ PORK & Ground Beef). Great great great!!  Highly recommend!!!

Having frequented the Hells Kitchen location extensively, we decided to go to the LES location as we were in the area.

I'm happy to say that the experience was a positive one. We ordered a host of empanadas, inckuding the Bombay, Brasil, Shredded Chicken, and Viagra, and enjoyed all of them. For dessert, we ordered the Nutella and Banana Empanada (delicious, with a kick of cinnamon) and the Romeo and Juliet Empanada (novel but extremely cheesy with a hint of guava).

The service was quite efficient and the place was playing wonderful, upbeat music that really brought the place alive. Highly recommend!

I was so hungry and worried about the wait, since it‚Äôs pretty popular. We got there just in time to taste an amazing frozen margarita, delicious yellow rice and beans, that my sister almost bit my hand of trying to sneak a bite. The tostones were the best I‚Äôve had in a long time. Crunchy on the edges and thicker in the middle which is different for me and so damn good! I love me some different. The empanadas to get is the Viagra and Bourbon Chicken. I will not stop raving about these two until the day I die. Magnificent.

Of course, our waiter, damn, I didn‚Äôt get his name, was amazing. So courteous, so sweet, and made us laugh a lot. Great experience and outstanding food. I am definitely returning to this location.

Best Empanada, I have ever HAD!
My server Mireya, was amazing. She deserves a RAISE! She gave us great recommendations on what to get!

Our Food, was fresh, delicious and No complaint. It is homemade and nothing is artificial. I will say DEFINITELY MUST GO PLACE!

I had such a great experience here! The server Felipe was absolutely amazing ‚Äî friendly, attentive, and made us feel right at home. They were knowledgeable about the menu and gave great recommendations. The natural juices were fresh and bursting with flavor, and the empanadas were some of the best I‚Äôve ever had ‚Äî perfectly crisp on the outside and full of delicious, savory filling. You can really tell everything is made with care. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!

The empanadas was very good.  I wouldn't order anything else.  Sangria was disgusting, felt like they thru a bunch of cheap alcohol into a pitcher and mixed it up with some cheap juices.  The guacamole was not good.  Everything else we order was disgusting. Stick to the empanadas and you'll be ok.

In my opinion this place is overrated. Yes, some of the empanadas are good but others are just average. What turned me off from the place was the poor service. The wait time was extremely long for just empanadas to come out and to my surprise the manager was not welcoming at all! My food took so long to come out that I decided to sit inside to eat and I was told by the manager who was sitting and eating at a table next to me (in regular clothes) that I can‚Äôt sit there because tables are only for indoor dining. He didn‚Äôt even introduce himself as an employee so it was a very awkward interaction. I asked if he worked there and said, are you really going to make me leave? I ended up staying but what also struck me was that the manager himself did not even wipe his table down after getting up from eating, when all of the tables have a sign that says they‚Äôve been sanitized. No employee cleaned it.  AND I found a small hair in my flan.
Muy buen lugar la comida muy Fresca un sabor exquisito y La atenci√≥n de Felipe espectacular.Las empanadas a otro nivel .La bandeja paisa deliciosa

I ordered the bandeja paisa. The taste was nice, you could taste that all the ingredients were fresh. The employees in the restaurant were nice and friendly. The price of the bandeja paisa was around 30 USD dollars. It's not cheap, but for New York it's pretty good.
One of the best empanadas I've ever eaten, a variety of filling and dough options, the corn dough is AMAZING, everyone should try it, I just think there should be more filling options for this dough.

I ordered food at 11:15am. Delivery estimate was 11:51. At 1:30 the food was still not delivered. I called 3 times and each time they said the driver was minutes away. They just kept lying. The chownow app stated that this restaurant uses their own delivery drivers so they could not do anything about it nor cancel or refund. This is the absolute worse place to order delivery. Additionally, the food was cold, egg had a shell, and avocado looked awful. Never again.

We were sat at a decent time. Me and my friend order brunch items. I ordered steak and eggs and he ordered pancakes. My dish came and his didn‚Äôt. After 30 minutes his pancakes still never came as my food was getting cold sitting in front of me waiting for his. It was hard to get our servers attention. So I had to get up and find her to find out the kitchen skipped his order. I found the server printing out a receipt of our food to go back to kitchen with it. They looked at the ticket like they never received it. We then waited another 15 minutes with still no food. After trying to get the servers attention again we asked her for a to go box for my food and drinks to go and the bill b/c we were just over it at this point‚Ä¶.. she couldn‚Äôt even bring us that. Again, we got up to find her. Again, they brought out just one drink and had to wait about 10 minutes for the next one. When making orders why do it partially? I never got my to go box so I had to leave my food. The server decided to only charge us for the 2 drinks & as we were leaving the pancakes finally came out and we just took them to go.

Lastly I wanted to add that there should be NO REASON a baby is at the bar! I brought it to security‚Äôs attention and I don‚Äôt think he understood English and I brought it to our servers attention & she said ‚Äúoh that‚Äôs not my baby‚Äù like girl I know that ‚Ä¶ The baby should not be at the bar!

Poor service very disappointed . The steak I had was wayyy too chewy ‚Ä¶

I was really happy to find this 24hr spot on my last day in NYC. It was perfect for a quick brunch by the hotel before heading to the airport. They have three vegan empanadas: portobello, rice & beans, and veggie. I got the lunch special for $12.50 which includes your choice or two empanadas with a side of rice and beans. The veggie empanada was my favorite. The filling reminded me a bit of a pot pie. The portobello Empanada was really good also. The mushroom flavor came through strongly and was pretty meaty. It's nice to have 24hr vegan options!

First time dropping in and noticed the huge assortment of empanadas available. The list is pretty long so you can spend a good amount of money trying out different flavors during your visit or multiple visits. Picked up 5 of them which where all very unique and flavorful. The best one I ordered was the one called viagra which came with shrimp and some other seasoning making it the perfect combination for a non meat empanada even after reheating at home. If they offered a bit of a combo deal when you ordered a group of empanadas that would help offset the cost.

Great variety of empanadas, can't wait to try them all. We had breakfast and a sandwich and all the portions were super big. They also have a window for take out that you can wait inside. The service was good and the girls were really nice. In general it could be a little bit cheaper in my opinion!

La comida, las bebidas üòçüòçüòçü§§ü§§ü§§ Deliciosa. Pero el servicio no me gust√≥ mucho porq fui como turista a new York y primera vez q visitaba el restaurante, hice mi pedido por una computadora que tienen en la pared y luego q me siento a esperar me informan y la mesera no me puede atender porq le ten√≠a q pedir la comida a ella. Igual dejamos propina! Pero tengan en cuenta ese detalle.

Empanada were delicious and fairly priced. Pictured is the Romeo and Juliet, Cubano and philly cheesteak. I also tried the baked spinach, that was my fave but I ate it before I remembered to take a picture üòÖ‚Ä¶

I almost always order takeout. My favorites are El Toro, El Jeffe & Viagra. I've tried almost all their flavors ü§£.
The space is mellow & truthfully they might need a bigger store.

4/13/22: Had the cheeseburger and cheese steak empanadas (both 4.75*) and the Bombay and spicy chicken (both 4 stars). Subtracting 2 stars because it's very overpriced for counter service: came out to $20 for 4 medium sized empanadas which are just about enough to fill a hungry person up.
All the empanadas were perfect crispy on the outside. It took 11 minutes, so I‚Äôm assuming they were freshly made and not just reheated.

This is my spot!  I feel like their iconic, maybe to me!

What stands out are the corn shelled empanadas.  They are among very few restaurants here in the city that offer it.  In all 5 boroughs.  I think I‚Äôve found one food truck in Queens and another restaurant that was in Jersey.

I had the lunch special which was 2 empanadas with rice and beans.  One empanada was ground beef and the other was the Viagra which is a shrimp empanada.

Both delicious with the green and red sauces.
Second time here and it never disappoints. Food is great, large selection, service is fast and friendly. One of the best empanadas in NYC.
